website_summaries.verdict: A unique router option from ASUS that stands above the competition in terms of usefulness and design.
pros: A pleasing exterior design means you can keep the router anywhere in the home
Included app support for Android and iOS devices extends the usefulness of the router
cons: Lack of an antenna can make connectivity spotty at times

website_summaries.verdict: A router that delivers superb wireless performance in all directions.
pros: Includes a congestion-sensing antenna that identifies the least-crowded channel to deliver outstanding WiFi performance
Router updates its firmware and security software on its own
Features "Wave Control" that allows you to prioritize traffic to various devices by waving your hand
Simple to manage via the Google On app for Android and iOS devices
cons: Router sometimes powers on and off by itself
Lacks the customization features of comparable routers

website_summaries.verdict: The Asus Google OnHub SRT-AC1900 is a dual-band 802.11ac router that is easy to set up and control with your smartphone. Although it looks slick and delivers good close-range throughput, it lacks many of the management features we expect at this price.
cons: Long-range performance was less than stellar in testing

customer_reviews.title: The speeds it produced with our modem were fantastic and I loved the ability to prioritize devices
customer_reviews.text: This router may be a 5-star review for some. The speeds it produced with our modem were fantastic and I loved the ability to prioritize devices. However, the range isn't that great and does not work well in older homes with plaster walls. It also did not play well with our range extender. We ultimately returned this and opted for the Orbi WiFi system which is AMAZING. If you have a relatively small place and don't have plaster walls, this will probably be an absolutely perfect product for you.
customer_reviews.author: BookieBeans

customer_reviews.title: We love this!
customer_reviews.text: So much better than our old Linksys A/C router that I'm giddy. I'm not an early adopter on technology, so waited awhile before upgrading. Now I wish that I hadn't waited. We have lots of people around consistently, and this thing rarely backs up due to the demand. We've got a stronger signal everywhere in the house with half the footprint on the counter. I don't have to worry about which frequency to connect each device to, the router picks the best one automatically. I hope the reliability matches its performance.
customer_reviews.author: EJIII.

customer_reviews.title: Google Mesh, with more coverage, for cheaper!
customer_reviews.text: I got two, since they run Google meshing software, *and* have better antennas than the pucks, *and* have bargain prices for used and refurb units. I could have gotten away with only one covering my house (since I get good signal all throughout the house interior, 1,300 sq ft. on one floor), but, well, there's a backyard, and I wanted to sit out there and watch Netflix.... so I could justify the additional cost, and tell myself that I would have a backup unit in case one went bad.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Chmara

customer_reviews.title: Latest firmware made it unstable
customer_reviews.text: This was a great router for two and a half years. Then somehow it started to randomly disconnect, particularly with Apple devices. Then it stated to happen to many other devices. IP6 is now screwed up as is the band switching (2ghz v 5ghz). Devices will randomly lose connection and not be able to reconnect. It was a great router when it worked - the range is fantastic, easy to manage, etc. Just not anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Long time Amazon shopper

customer_reviews.title: Bricked in under 2 years, Google Wifi support stopped responding after 2 factory resets
customer_reviews.text: Replaced our Netgear router 2019-04-22 and immediately saw 2x speed increase in low signal room, but it just bricked 2020-06-02! I was sold on the hardware and software pushing the improved signal and speed, but apparently it's faulty, Google Wifi support stopped responding after a factory reset didn't work, and I likely can't get the RMA I submitted approved via ASUS's website because their support is unreachable. I replaced a crashing Netgear with an OnHub that's permanently bricked. I'd rather go back to Netgear, at least it recovered!
customer_reviews.author: Nathaniel Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Smart Phone controlled router
customer_reviews.text: Works great with smart phone google wifi app. Better than my old router from Walmart. Can priortize which devices should run the fastest, great for homes with 3-5 people. Almost seemed like a waste for a 2 person home. Would purchase again, if I was looking for a router that you don't have to log onto your personal computer to manage, and if I lived with more people. Lots of neat adjustable settings that are easy to do in the apple store google wifi app. You can even shut the lights off on it to save energy and not have bright lights at night.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Great until started to drop connections
customer_reviews.text: let me say that this thingis fast and awesome to use. Easy to set up, looks great. Issue started happening where it would just drop connection as many other reviews sayon here, sad because i really liked this thing when it worked. Comparing to an asus ac68u, this thing would get me as a bridged router 280mbps of my 300 plan. My ac68u gets me around 220-230. Still good but this thing was fire...when it worked. maybe works better in regular router mode, but that wasn't my intent of the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: REGG

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous product
customer_reviews.text: Second Onhub i've purchased because they are just the bees knees. Install and forget. I have 2 Onhubs and a 3 pack google wifi pucks around the house. My house is bathed in wifi goodness. I recommend these to all my Apple head friends for hassle free experience after apple discontinued their airport devices. Go go google.
customer_reviews.author: Mitch

customer_reviews.title: It ... sings?
customer_reviews.text: Periodically, this makes a melodic sound for about three seconds and it's very loud. I do not know how to make it quieter or to prevent it from making sound at all. I think it may be every time someone attempts to sign into the network, but I really haven't been able to figure it out. Otherwise, it functions well. Just be prepared to be awoken in the middle of the night very confused as to where an electronic tune is coming from.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney

customer_reviews.title: The way a router should be
customer_reviews.text: This is what a router should be like! I can easily see a list of all devices on my network, along with their bandwidth consumption. But, to me, the killer feature is that I can reboot this thing from anywhere in the world, right from the app on my phone. This is important for us because our home security cameras are completely dependent on Wifi. If the network goes down, no more security cameras. So it was pretty essential that I be able to reboot the router remotely, in case something goes haywire. (Of course, if my ISP goes down - there's still nothing I can do about that.)
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas M. Spreitzer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing router, but slightly limited functionality.
customer_reviews.text: This router is amazing. I've tried three different AC routers in my house and had serious interference issues on the 5GHz bands in all cases. The link wasn't as fast as it should have been and then it would simply drop every 5 minutes or so. This router has had 0 issues so far. I don't know if it's the smart band searching or what it is, but it's amazing. I did however take one star because the usb port on the rear cannot be used to attach an external harddrive for network attached storage. I'm hopeful that changes with a software update, but it's not terrible.
customer_reviews.author: CS

customer_reviews.title: Simple to set up. Great for People that just need WiFi
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up. Automatic updates. Chooses between 2.4 and 5 Ghz. Fairly good signal. Classy look to place on book shelf or end table. I did have to put my cable provided modem into bridge mode and because the OnHub only has one port out I had to buy an 8 port switch. Requires a smart phone to configure via Google Wifi app. It is a few years old. Uses 1 SSID for both channels. Not much as far as customization.
customer_reviews.author: Brian P.

customer_reviews.title: In Support Limbo with wi-fi not working after unit had auto update
customer_reviews.text: After 2 1/2 months, this unit is no longer transmitting Wi-Fi even though the app shows it is. Have eliminated all environment variables. This started happening after update was pushed to unit automatically. Unit still works if connected via ethernet, but not for wi-fi. Going on day 3 of working with Google wi-fi support and having my work affected. At this point I need to go and buy a different unit as I can't be in support limbo until they finally find a solution. Have spent so many hours trying to fix this. Would not buy this unit again. Google has been sending out poor updates on many devices of late.
customer_reviews.author: Kristy

customer_reviews.title: Great as router for smaller area. Use to build a Mesh system.
customer_reviews.text: Bought the Asus over the Google for the antenna array and looks. Connected with a google WiFi 3 pack and have a great Mesh WiFi system.Can't find a bad spot in a 3000' house. I also have powerline ethernet but it does not have the speed of the WiFi.
customer_reviews.author: Rod

customer_reviews.title: I know it has almost no user tweaks like most other routers
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace another Asus router that bit the dust in a lightning storm. I know it has almost no user tweaks like most other routers, but it just works. It seems to work better than any wireless router I have ever had. Google has added feature to it over time such as family controls and support for their new mesh network. The app is also easy to use and well designed. I also like that it supports IFTTT. Power users may not like its simpicity, but I like its ease of use and reliability. I would recomend it to any one who would like an easy to set up router that works like a champ.
customer_reviews.author: Cbet_gator

customer_reviews.title: Great product - just a little tricky to setup as a mesh
customer_reviews.text: If you are buying one of these - you are good to go! Setup is a breeze and the app management is awesome. However if you are buying 2 to mesh together, it is easy to get frustrated. The key is this.... Plug the 2nd one up to the internet and leave it overnight or at least 12 hours. It will automatically update to the latest firmware. Once this is done setting up the mesh is a breeze!
customer_reviews.author: Xavier

customer_reviews.title: Set it and forget it!
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic router if you are looking for something to set and forget. The app makes it really easy to set up, and once it is on, you can expect it to run without problems. The wifi signal is great (much better than my previous AT&T router) and it transmits very close to the actual down speed you pay for. I highly recommend this router for people who don't want to fool around with complicated set up pages, ip addresses and customizations. It really is designed for people who just want something that works well.
customer_reviews.author: SpoonerStreet

customer_reviews.title: OnHub: Making WiFi Great Again!
customer_reviews.text: This one router resolved my WiFi woes! I basically have Uvese & despite receiving 2 routers from AT&T I could never get ANY signal 20 feet away! After ordering OnHub and setting it up (which was far easier than I expected (I now have WiFi through out my entire house & half way down the street! Note: make sure you put a password on your WiFi lest your neighbors or "wandering" folks seeking good accidentally hop on--yeah, OnHub's range is incredible! Also, due to its unusual beauty (routers are typically ugly) make sure friends & family know that it's a router & not some random geek decoration (lest they pick it up & accidentally unplug the cool "alien" device!).
customer_reviews.author: Darnell

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed - It's great if it continues to function.
customer_reviews.text: This is great router and worked flawlessly for 6 weeks. At week 6, 2 weeks after my return window closed and while I was at work, I was alerted that I was no longer connected to the internet. When I got home there was no light on, and no signs of any damage. I tried a few different outlets to make sure something didn't go wrong with my equipment but this router was done. It bothers me that it only lasted 6 weeks of use as Asus is usually much more dependable in the router dept. Now I am doing an RMA thru Google/Asus so we will see what happens when the new unit gets here.
customer_reviews.author: ThirdWave

customer_reviews.title: . Great Wi-Fi router!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up and works great. We have Spectrum Wi-Fi and were having trouble getting a signal Throughout the house but with this Wi-Fi router we have a strong signal on both floors and even the backyard. Plus I no longer have to pay $10 a month to rent a router from spectrum.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy T

customer_reviews.title: Good singal strength and coverage
customer_reviews.text: I love this router, it has great signal strength and mobile app to control all the basic features. Speed is awesome, no spikes or lags. Also looks good and stylish. One cons - it was hard to connect it to Internet for the first time, because to setup this router you will need DHCP without any mac address filtering on the ISP side. There is no web interface and no telnet. So, I had to contact with provider's support to connect this router. Would be good to have a basic web interface, not just the app.
customer_reviews.author: Sloan Vadim

customer_reviews.title: Best 2016 Purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Super easy set-up, parental/guest controls from my smartphone (Google account), dual-band, user-friendly app, can prioritize any device, great design (no ugly anetennas), and biggest plus: no paying extra for customer service support!!! (I called Google to be sure before purchasing.) Will NEVER purchase Netgear ever again. Threw out most recent $200 (POS) Nighthawk esp after being told I would have to pay a $140 service contract for support.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Works well and easy to set up.
customer_reviews.text: Picked this up just a week ago so only a short term review. Router looks nice, was easy easy easy to set up. The App will walk you through some simple steps if it does not work at first (Mine did not) and got it going after that and pretty much been solid since. The range and speed are nice, it has tripled my downstairs speed as this lives in my upstairs office but my main smart tv etc are down stairs. All in all if you are looking for simple setup and don't need a lot of customizing to your router I don't think you can go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Pickett

customer_reviews.title: Good strong router
customer_reviews.text: This router is working great. eliminated all the dead spots from my previous router in my 2500 sq ft house. Only complaint is that there is only one wired port on it so I have to use a switch if I want any wired connections. I like the app for the iphone to be able to see the router connections, but i would love it if you could manage the connections/setup over a computer web browser like a traditional router. Minus one star for lack of wired ports and pc interface.
customer_reviews.author: Dave D

customer_reviews.title: Quick impressions - awesome product, incredibly easy setup
customer_reviews.text: Quick impressions - awesome product, incredibly easy setup. Only issue I ran into was the "communicating between device and phone app" I had to manually enter the code - not a huge deal, but it would have been cool to have it talk like it says it should. Immediately increased my signal strength by a large margin. House is 2500sq ft, and I have at least 3 bars throughout. Family room addition on the back of the house has an interior brick wall that always killed wifi signals, and it penetrated with ease. Set up with a Time Warner supplied wifi cable modem, very quickly set NAT to bridge mode, disabled their wifi and ssid broadcast, and haven't look back.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Griffis

customer_reviews.title: Video conferencing got better, gaming got smoother and the app that comes ...
customer_reviews.text: After 15 years, I finally moved on from my Linksys WRT54GL. It took me a lot of research and peer review but I finally went with the Asus OnHub and I was incredibly impressed. I'm a hard core gamer, a remote employee who lives on line working and video conferencing all day and this router is everything I ever wanted. Video conferencing got better, gaming got smoother and the app that comes with it makes troubleshooting household tech issues quick and easy. So easy I don't really have to deal with anything. Unboxing and set up was super easy. I was back on the air in less than 20 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt Stangl

customer_reviews.title: Best router ever!
customer_reviews.text: This router is insanely easy to setup and fast. I started with using it as a separate wireless network plugging it to a router. It worked immediately. Decided later to change later to bridge mode and with a few clicks on the iPhone, it just worked frictionlessly, no need to mess with the IP settings, the configuration that other routers does. My previous netgear ac wifi range on both 2.4 GHz and 5GHz had problem covering the 2 levels of house. Now with this setup, coverage is complete and signal strength is great! Works flawlessly with IOS and Chromecast devices. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Rotaflex

customer_reviews.title: Poor QA means I can't recommend it
customer_reviews.text: After 1 week, the unit powered down by itself. Whether it was the power supply or the router itself was not possible to figure out. What was true in either case, the product was not stable. A router's necessity in the home is like a zipper on your pants. If it fails you won't die but its not really the level of quality that is a selling point either. It was rather easy to setup but since I use it to access work remotely, obviously it couldn't be relied upon so I returned it. The only way around this is to have a backup router at home which is too bad.
customer_reviews.author: Robert M.

customer_reviews.title: Sleek, Sexy, Reliable, FAR reaching and FAST!
customer_reviews.text: Exceptional range and performance! Doesn't need to be reset every week like my old routers! It would be nice if the USB port did something (firmware update to enable functionality allegedly coming soon). At all times I have 10+ devices connected, maxing out at 20. This thing is a beast and handles uploads/downloads and streaming with ease. The "hand wave" priority sensor is gimmicky though, I've never used it. I like this better than the TP-Link OnHub variant.
customer_reviews.author: TheAndrewLane

customer_reviews.title: Totally worthwhile for the connected home.
customer_reviews.text: This single device permits the addition of multiple devices, like an Amazon Echo, and an Amazon Tap, and an Amazon Dot, and an Amazon Fire TV stick, and four Amazon Kindles, in addition to Windows 7, 8.1 and 10 computers plus various smartphones and Apple devices simultaneously. In comparison to upgrading the DSL to cable, it was an inexpensive, easy to set up and highly effective alternative. The range is an improvement and the intelligent addressing of downloads (versus maintenance checking in by devices) helps prevent crashes and overall instability.
customer_reviews.author: Danny S.

customer_reviews.title: Buy this one if you don't know anything about networking and want Google to help you
customer_reviews.text: This router is really idiot-proof. One of the easiest setup routers I've ever used. What I don't like about it is that it does everything for me (e.g. automatically select best channels, auto update firmwares, .etc). This is not necessarily a bad thing but I wish I could have more control of it such as turning off 2.4GHz band or switching on bandwidth monitoring.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Nice little gadget. First one got stolen off my porch!
customer_reviews.text: Once I got the replacement from the one ripped out of the box left on my porch!!! ... Love the auto-channel switching. Seems like there are a bazillion people's wireless devices buzzing all around and this device will switch to the best channel as needed. Wish I could configure it the old fashioned way though, but I am sure Google will send updates as required and it might be configurable in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Lys Forte

customer_reviews.title: ... of my wimpy 6 Mbs "broadband" Set up was super easy, I personally like that everything you need ...
customer_reviews.text: This helped get the most out of my wimpy 6 Mbs "broadband" Set up was super easy, I personally like that everything you need to configure, test, change settings is on my smart phone. Powerful signal- I can walk down to the neighbors house +/- a half mile and still have signal. Very pleased. Hardest part was running CAT5e cable from basement and up the wall to top of kitchen cabinets, even this took less than 20 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: It’s better & less expensive than the similar Google brand router.
customer_reviews.text: It has better Wi-Fi coverage than the Google brand router. Since it has 13 internal antennas. And it’s very easy to install & manage through the Google Wi-Fi app.
customer_reviews.author: A1 Computer Consulting

customer_reviews.title: Amazing setup, great router, fully recommended
customer_reviews.text: The setup for this router was a pleasure. It was so clear what needed to be done, when I needed to wait, etc, that I had no fear I wasn't doing it right. What is generally a frustrating process full of uncertainty was almost pleasurable. As for the performance of the router itself, I am very happy with the results a few weeks in. Some issues I was having with connection speed went away immediately. I had previously assumed it was my cable company screwing up.
customer_reviews.author: Jake and Alisha

customer_reviews.title: The OnHub has allowed me to have one single router that provides good coverage throughout
customer_reviews.text: I've been very impressed with the OnHub. Before I was using two separate wireless routers with separate networks to try to provide coverage throughout the house. That caused other problems. The OnHub has allowed me to have one single router that provides good coverage throughout. I particularly like the ability to prioritize a specific device for a period of time. I have around 20 devices or so connected at any given time so to be able to prioritize my Xbox One for instance, while I watch a movie, is great.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Lytle

customer_reviews.title: Tough to set up, Customer Service excellent, works fine.
customer_reviews.text: Had to involve customer service and it took about an hour to get set up originally. CS was excellent and patient. It started immediately with no coaxing, etc. after we were without power for 2 1/2 days. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Topsailbob

customer_reviews.title: Simple to use home router
customer_reviews.text: I had a few rooms that were dead spots. Since I have starting using the Onhub I'm getting speeds of 25mbp and above throughout the house. Also, the app is super easy to mantain your home network. It puts you in more control over your network. Its a great value to anyone no matter what level of knowledge you have of networking. I have a dozen or so device's running and everything is silky smooth.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Best mesh WiFi blanket ever.
customer_reviews.text: I had 2 previous onhubs, 1 TP-Link and 1 Asus, just neede a 3rd one to completely cover my house with the new Google WiFi function. Totally worth it. Works much better than a 3-pack of Google WiFi pucks. All I'm missing now is the ability to schedule connections per device/user/etc, and that will make me the happiest WiFi user in the world. It will go to 5 stars once that happens.
customer_reviews.author: Blunt-JJ

customer_reviews.title: Be sure to have an internet connecting cell phone.
customer_reviews.text: We replaced the spectrum router with this one. It works great. You have to purchase an Ethernet network switch to go with it to connect any other wired devices and an Ethernet patch internet cable as well. Installation was a little difficult for me being a 65 year old without much experience. It requires using a cell phone to install. I am happy with the way it is working for us since we are streaming all of our television viewing.
customer_reviews.author: Jano

customer_reviews.title: Useful
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for a while but, after going in and out with the signal, finally stopped working. We had to get a replacement from our internet provider. With that said, a good value for this item for the price we paid.
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: ... had this router for a few years now and love it, never have to reset things and it ...
customer_reviews.text: I have had this router for a few years now and love it, never have to reset things and it handles a lot of devices at once (I have smart home devices plus lots of guests who get on my wifi) also the range is great, we have a 3300 square foot two story house and have this in the bottom left corner and it covers the whole house easily without any issue. Great device!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product, highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: What a great router! I don't know how it stacks up to others, but for everyday use in the home it is perfect. I have a fairly large home (3900 soft) and the router is located in the far corner of the house on the main floor (middle) floor. I have virtually the same speed in all corners of the house 95-109 Mbps download and 10-11.9 Mbps upload. My service provider is limited to 100 and 10 Mbps. Super easy to set up! A must buy for the home, I would highly recommend this router.
customer_reviews.author: Paul C.

customer_reviews.title: Buy this Wireless Router
customer_reviews.text: Buy this wireless router if you want fast, efficient wireless connections. For the longest time I was paying for download speeds of 20+ GBs and only effectively getting 7 or 8 GBs due to an insufficient wireless router. Plus other wireless products (specifically a Bose subwoofer) were interfering with my wireless signal complicating the issue. Well...those days are over! This dual banded wireless router fixed everything! Everything now works seamlessly. My download speeds are even faster than what I am paying for! I am paying for 18 GBs...and I am getting 22 GBs. Amazing!!
customer_reviews.author: MFDA

customer_reviews.title: Much better wi-fi than with cable company supplied router
customer_reviews.text: Works well when attached to existing cable modem I bought a longer than supplied cable wire to set this up in the center of my house. Need an Android device to log onto Google to setup and monitor performance. Much better wi-fi than with cable company supplied router, plus guest network for non-critical on line stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Randomly stopped turning on one day
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for a while and then simply wouldn't turn back on despite following all of the self help tests. Contacted "Support" and was told that it was out of warranty and their solution is to pay a $35 non-refundable fee to have them look at it, then wait for another bill as they try to charge me more to fix it. When I said it probably makes more sense to just buy another one they said I SHOULD. Never buying another ASUS product if this is the "support" I'm going to receive.
customer_reviews.author: David LaVallee

customer_reviews.title: A Great Router to Buy
customer_reviews.text: This router is just great. My internet speeds are fast and consistent. Previously my speeds would vary wildly. Now I have a solid fast connection throughout my whole house. It is easy to setup and manage. No firmware to upgrade. This router will update itself.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Harris

customer_reviews.title: Haven't had to reset once.
customer_reviews.text: I used to have to reset my TP-Link router ever other day, but not with this bad boy. I haven't run into a single issue with this router. Netflix runs noticeably faster on my Roku 3, and setup was super simple. There is a substantial update at first, but that's understandable I guess. This router does lack more advanced functionality, but for the average user this is a wonderful piece of tech.
customer_reviews.author: Brock W. Volio

customer_reviews.title: Great Internet Connectivity!
customer_reviews.text: Great Google router, particuarly in front of a Google Mesh WIFI setup. Couldn't like it more. Doesn't hurt that future software and firmware updates are automatic!
customer_reviews.author: Randy W.

customer_reviews.title: Great signal in a 100 year old home!
customer_reviews.text: I live in a 100 year old home with plaster and large walls and it has always been difficult to get a good signal from one corner of the house to the opposite corner but the ASUS Onhub pulls it off flawlessly. Great signal strength all over the house and even outside in my yard. I get a good signal about 25' - 30' away from the house on all sides.
customer_reviews.author: BigBadWolfe

customer_reviews.title: Great Router.
customer_reviews.text: Love this guy, just one of this was able to resolve my dead spot issue after Google release the WiFi app, I'm getting consistently 60-75MB around my home even in the furthest bedroom, it looks good and it does the job and I was able to buy it for $75 during a promo that Amazon had. FYI, after the Google WiFi app update this router can also be used as a Mesh device.
customer_reviews.author: Miguel Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Google software combined with the quality of an Asus router.
customer_reviews.text: Upgrading from an OLD Apple AirPort Extreme and crummy TP-Link Switch. So far so good. A friend has this router and highly suggested it. Easy to setup, the app is fluid and easy to use. Looks great Gives me great WiFi speeds. I love the Prioritization feature as well. I paired this with the Nighthawk S8000 Gaming Switch which I have read is a great combo and from personal use so far, I can definitely say it exceeds my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Greg King

customer_reviews.title: Simply horrible
customer_reviews.text: This model Is from 2016 and in technology 3 years is century!!!, the speed was horrible, connection was easy, and reliable for 24 hr, I returned the next day.
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo Ch

customer_reviews.title: Great router. We have at least 4 items streaming ...
customer_reviews.text: Great router. We have at least 4 items streaming and using heavy Internet at anytime in our household. No problems at all. Set up is super easy. The only item we need plugged in to ethernet is a phone range extender. If more then one item that needs plugged into ethernet this is not for you. It keeps a steady connection and is always using at least 85%of Internet availability.
customer_reviews.author: Shane Major

customer_reviews.title: Coming up to 6 months owning this router
customer_reviews.text: Coming up to 6 months owning this router. Only issue I have had with this was the latest update from Google that factory reset the router, but this was easily fixed and the house was running data in no time. So far, this has been excellent, the app is fantastically useful . The wifi reach is the best I have had with any other router. So far so good :)
customer_reviews.author: Brie

customer_reviews.title: Great router, solves problems.
customer_reviews.text: Has solved all my wi-fi issues. Being in a somewhat densely populated neighborhood, interference and dropped connections have been consistent issues across 3 -4 routers. No more. After the very easy install, following the clearly written directions, it fired up and I've had rock solid connectivity and great speeds ever since. It updates itself in the background, and the app is a nice way to be able to keep track of what is going on. It's a little pricey at first, but it costs less than buying another router every 12 - 24 months when you get fed up with the speeds and dropped connections of your old one.
customer_reviews.author: ABD

customer_reviews.title: Buy it!!
customer_reviews.text: This wi fi router is the bomb. Easy to set up, super powerful, has it's own app. It broadcasts over my entire house (3000 square foot) and my phone connects as I approach the driveway. Doesn't get better then this. No more complaints about wi fi from the husband and the kid. We all game, and this can actually be used to connect and play without the massive lag we get when using our wifi gateway.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor range and constant disconnections make this product hard for me to love
customer_reviews.text: Poor range. I have two different cable carriers right now, and the cheap 12mbps ATT modem/router gets a better signal in parts of the house than this so-called beastly router. Then there are the constant disconnects. When I try to reconnect, it prompts my password like it was never saved. When I put in my password, which is just my phone number, it says my password is incorrect. After doing this maybe 5 times, it will finally "register," only to do this again the next day. Yeah, really "easy." No thanks.
customer_reviews.author: W. Lobb

customer_reviews.title: In love
customer_reviews.text: I am in love of this router, set-up is so easy, you even get a few advanced options like port forwarding. The pause function is a blessing. I only wish the wifi reach to be farther than my old router, but buying another one to create a mesh network is the goal
customer_reviews.author: Edgardo Rivera

customer_reviews.title: Works with Frontier Fios high speed internet.
customer_reviews.text: I use this with my Frontier Fios 200/200 internet access and it works great. Very easily installed and I’ve had zero problems with it so far.
customer_reviews.author: Shoelesssam

customer_reviews.title: Technologically brilliant!
customer_reviews.text: I've owned over a dozen wireless routers from different brands with all were $200+. The impressive piece about this product is the ability to learn the main connection speed from the internet and adjust the different attached devices to optimize. Don't realize how impressive it is until by day 3 or 4 of continuous use. All this is in addition to being easy and seemless to install!
customer_reviews.author: Mohamad Hussein

customer_reviews.title: Major improvement in my WiFi speed
customer_reviews.text: A friend recommended we get this router because we would notice an improvement in our internet speed. He was right. I can now lay in the room and watch videos without the lag. I would recommend this unit if you are having issues watching videos. We live in a fairly small home so this unit is just right for our needs.
customer_reviews.author: Germaine

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't get much better...
customer_reviews.text: I went from the Luma mesh network to this beauty, paired with the 3-pack, Google Wi-Fi mesh setup. Cannot say enough good things. Have not had to worry about network issues since I made the switch. I get just about my full wired speed, over wifi, on all ends of my 3K sqft home, over both 2.4 and 5GHz wireless frequencies. WELL WORTH!
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Ok. Not great
customer_reviews.text: Onhub is OK, not great. It tends to drop connections more often than my old unit did.
customer_reviews.author: LJG

customer_reviews.title: Faulty router?
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for a couple days. Now I'm getting wifi speeds of .2 Mbps compared to 170 that I was getting before. This is on all devices except for the one hardwired device that is still getting great speeds update: unit was replaced underwarranty and fixed the problem, but now the issue has comeback. probably will only use google.com instead of any of there other products from now on
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: set up was fast and easy. before i was running repeaters in my 3 ...
customer_reviews.text: had a few reservations before purchasing this--especially the on hub has only ONE port. unit arrived- and I am impressed! set up was fast and easy. before i was running repeaters in my 3 story townhouse(plus basement) now with just the on hub i am getting full bar(wifi strength ) everywhere- even the backyard without repeaters!!! yes- i can live with one WAN port!!!
customer_reviews.author: wackydude5

customer_reviews.title: BEST ROUTER I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: My wireless connection (provided by the modem/router provided by Time Warner Cable) would previously cut out frequently, even though if only for a few seconds, at least 3-4 days a week. I've had the Onhub router since the end of July, and I haven't lost my connection once! And, FINALLY, a router that's NOT UGLY and has only one thin light at the base of the unit. Easy to "hide" anywhere I want it.
customer_reviews.author: patmatt56

customer_reviews.title: Strong signal, great ease of use
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking to take ask the work out of operating your wireless router, this is a great option. Strong signal, no dropped connections after install (unlike previous router). All controlled with an easy to use app on your phone. You will lose some advanced control other routers offer, but it works, and well.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Rich

customer_reviews.title: Good router.
customer_reviews.text: Great router. Strong and fast signal. Configuration is by phone app which is kind of odd but there's not that much they let you configure anyway. Have had some issues with my Vizio TV being able to see the wireless signal but besides that it had been rock solid and fast. I can get my wifi a block away.
customer_reviews.author: Harold Mccormick

customer_reviews.title: Quit working after a year-and-a-half
customer_reviews.text: Have had for about a year-and-a-half and it already quit working I've had routers that have lasted years. Very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Pixcm

customer_reviews.title: Might be better when it has more features
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup - good coverage. Very little control versus routers with same performance - most notably any sort of parental controls. Will NOT work with Circle device. There is much more lag than my older router, and I have even had to just switch off wifi and go cellular when I ran into issues and needed a site to load. Hope it gets better with updates.
customer_reviews.author: Steve in Sylvania

customer_reviews.title: Good router, minimal setup. Most people will love it.
customer_reviews.text: Great improvement over our previous AC router in both range and reliability. Currently delivering interwebs to 12 devices (Chromecasts, nests, consoles, pcs, laptops, tablets and phones). No hiccups. The app is pretty great for beginners. If you are a power user, think twice because everything is pretty closed off.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan C.

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly Quick WiFi
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these for my 4000 sqft house. It's not meant to have two on-hubs but a forum on Google will show you how to get around this. Took me about 30 minutes to get it all up and running. Great system and definitely worth the price. I now have full bars in every corner of my house and even my backyard!
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Like night and day VS Lynksys
customer_reviews.text: Wow, what a difference this router made in my home. Wifi signals that we previously needed an "extension router" to use is now blasting signal to every corner of the house! I completely recommend this router for homes that have larger square footage, and lots of walls between it and any "users".
customer_reviews.author: CROCHET QUEEN

customer_reviews.title: This product no longer works after 18 months. The ...
customer_reviews.text: This product no longer works after 18 months. The wifi started losing internet access randomly starting a few months ago and now it no longer works at all.
customer_reviews.author: Chile

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This thing is just awesome. Works very well. Software is easy to use and hardware works great.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Olesiak

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Router
customer_reviews.text: I gotta say, this router was a huge step up from my previous setup. It provides a much stronger and faster wireless signal than my last router. But the main thing for me was that the router is installed and maintained by using your smartphone. This is way more convenient than having to access your router's settings through a web browser. Some people don't like that there's only one wired port on the back of this router, but I imagine this product would serve the needs of 99% of all people. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Great for Parents and anyone who hates messing with their router all the time
customer_reviews.text: Man, so far this thing has just worked. I used to have so many issues with my router and now those issue are no more. I love the OnHUb app and that you can prioritize devices and you can set up groups. Basically you can group all of your childrens devices and block them whenever you don't want them to use the WiFi.
customer_reviews.author: DigitalAlien

customer_reviews.title: Good Router
customer_reviews.text: An excellent router, I’ve been using it for a year now. excellent signal, good stability, there is only one minus, if you move the router a little, the indicator starts to turn red and the Wi-Fi turns off for 1-2 minutes, I think this is a marriage of my device. Otherwise, everything is fine.
customer_reviews.author: Giorgi

customer_reviews.title: Best router I've had so far
customer_reviews.text: Best router I've had so far. It even beats my Apple routers in the past and all the others, of which there were many.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Tom

customer_reviews.title: We had internet issue in our appartment, to many ...
customer_reviews.text: We had internet issue in our appartment, to many wireless signals. so I searched around for a router with a strong wireless signal and we found it. Our internet no longer drops and we get the speed we pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Another Guy

customer_reviews.title: The best router I've used
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a Netgear wireless N router and repeater with this single router. The coverage is fantastic. Setup was easy. The only issue I've run into is that I need to run a cable to my utility room and install a switch where my old router was located to service the wired portion of my house.
customer_reviews.author: A. Soduk

customer_reviews.title: 3 Later and I still love it!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing router. I love the ability to troubleshoot the device from my iPhone. I've installed 3 so far. One in my house, one in my parents house, and one in my office. All 3 are easily accessed from my iPhone and you get a weekly email explaining how fast your internet access it. It also sends push notifications if it becomes offline, amazing device! Setup was a breeze and highly guided.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Pharm

customer_reviews.title: Boom! Speed on tap!
customer_reviews.text: Easiest Wi-Fi setup I've ever done. Such a user friendly system. Got an instant 200% boost in my home Wi-Fi over the xfinity modem access point. Much greater range now too. Looks good enough to leave on the tv stand in the open. Wife approved. Not for the hacker or power user. Yet.
customer_reviews.author: Spencaur!

customer_reviews.title: Slowdowns and ultimate failure
customer_reviews.text: Less than 6 months in, and it won't power on. Even before that, I was having problems where it would slow down to a crawl--LAN or WIFI connections--and it'd have to be turned off for quite a while to resolve the issue. I know the slow-down was on the OnHub because I could connect directly into the Modem via LAN or WIFI and it'd be fast as ever. Can't say I would recommend this...
customer_reviews.author: Jason Jones

customer_reviews.title: Overall, best router i have ever bought.
customer_reviews.text: The Asus Onhub is one of the best and most powerful routers you can get. This router uses ever bit of data you have to get the best performance possible. Simply get this router. Very easy set up, had it up and ruing in under 5 mins. Overall, best router i have ever bought.
customer_reviews.author: RedBeard

customer_reviews.title: works like it is supposed to
customer_reviews.text: It is Google controlled. You must use a mobile app to set it up and I don't have cell phone service at my cabin- had to drive into town. I prefer to control my router from my computer-old school.
customer_reviews.author: MARK

customer_reviews.title: The perfect WiFi Router
customer_reviews.text: I can not believe how well the Asus 'On Hub router works. Very easy set up. I have 12 devices; phones, tablets, PC's, laptops, streaming boxes, smart TV's and more. No lagging, very fast and simple "automatic" operation. And I get WiFi everywhere in my home and outside to well across my yard to the neighbors HOUSE and in my detached garage.
customer_reviews.author: Mr.John Frame & Mrs. Ruthanne Frame

customer_reviews.title: Don't care for the admin via mobile device only.
customer_reviews.text: Just okay. Did not find the signal strength to be high enough. The real show stopper was no desktop administrative ability. Using a smartphone for admin is just not as good.
customer_reviews.author: S. Lee

customer_reviews.title: won't work with my camer system
customer_reviews.text: Can't get it to work with my Zmodo system, did work with my computer but I need the cameras to connect.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: haven't droped service since we got this only cable throttled ...
customer_reviews.text: haven't droped service since we got this only cable throttled down but not this. so far flawless have gone through 4 wireless routers till this one.
customer_reviews.author: David P. Newell

customer_reviews.title: The app and this router are it for me. Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: An amazing router. The app for the router alerts you whenever connectivity is lost. What?! So cool. The signal strength is perfect and anyone can set this router up on their home. This thing is basically plug and play. Another hit for Asus and another hit for Google.
customer_reviews.author: Matches Malone

customer_reviews.title: Router is great and signal strength is very good
customer_reviews.text: Very well packed for shipment. Router is great and signal strength is very good. Sorted test was right on with the internet package that I have. Simple UI through Google WiFi app. Just so you know, the router chooses between 2.4 and 5 GHz automatically so you only have to name and use password for one band instead of 2 like other dual band routers
customer_reviews.author: Charles Smith

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to set up with your android phone
customer_reviews.text: I am totally blown away by this product! Very easy to set up with your android phone. I was losing the signal and had a lot of buffering while streaming on my Smart TV. I had a Netgear n600 that just wasn't doing the job anymore. I'm so glad I made the change. Reasonably priced too!
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen A. Brogan

customer_reviews.title: defective product
customer_reviews.text: even with almost an hour on the phone with tech support, couldn't get it to work.
customer_reviews.author: Heart

customer_reviews.title: Finally a router that works!
customer_reviews.text: I have 4 old routers in a box. They all work...very poorly. Each time I would read the reviews and purchase the one with best rating in my price range. This time I went with one that the reviews called overpriced and just ok. Thank you Google my Asus Onhub is the best router ever. I don't think it's over priced if you value your time getting the others to work. Onhub just works and is simple to understand. I can't say enough. Who needs 4 old Linksys routers?
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set-up
customer_reviews.text: Originally bought this thinking I'd eventually buy another or buy a Google WiFi disc to mesh with it. Turns out, the ASUS OnHub has enough signal strength all by itself. Easy to set-up, easy to control and limit access for kids or guests as well.
customer_reviews.author: Rancid Lunchmeat

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this router
customer_reviews.text: High speed internet, and works with the Google WiFi app to prioritize devices. So, I can make sure my xbox downloading things in the background doesn't interrupt my Neftlix. Also, it apparently meshes into the new Google WiFi network if you have those, so that's cool.
customer_reviews.author: AJ H.

customer_reviews.title: Fast, reliable, no fuss!
customer_reviews.text: This router is perfect for anyone who wants a solid, fast, no fuss wifi network. It's literally no maintenance. After replacing my aging router my speed test results went up dramatically. I had always blamed our cable company for slow speeds, but now I'm sure it was just outdated equipment. I did end up updating my modem too and now consistently get faster speeds than I even pay for. My existing modern topped out around 110 Mbps and would slow down during peek times. The combo I have now works great!!
customer_reviews.author: Justin C

customer_reviews.title: It's no dead spots in your house and good speed everywhere
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 of these making a mesh network for my house. I could have honestly got away with only 2 for my house. You don't know what mesh is? It's no dead spots in your house and good speed everywhere! I would buy and recommend this again.
customer_reviews.author: S. Reeves

product_meta.title: ASUS SRT-AC1900 AC1900 Onhub Google WiFi Router,Black
product_meta.description: Style:1x Gigabit LAN portsGoogle WiFI Router – Onhub AC1900 with Wave control
feature_bullets: The Google On app for Android and iOS allows simple setup and management
ASUS-exclusive Wave Control lets you prioritize traffic to devices with a wave of your hand
Smart high-performance internal antennas, selected power amplifiers and fine-tuned radio frequency design deliver wide wireless coverage in any direction
Congestion-sensing antenna searches for the least-crowded channel to give you optimal Wi-Fi performance
Firmware is automatically updated with the latest features and security upgrades

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars526 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
